description:
People say that the youthful days are always bittersweet, but maybe it's just bitter?

Kyouko Hori is a flashy high school girl, who, despite her ostentatious appearance, excels in academics and has a family-loving character. Izumi Miyamura is a bland high school boy, who, despite not wanting to stand out in class, secretly wears piercings outside of school and has a large body tattoo.

One day, Miyamura finds Hori's little brother injured and helps him back to Hori's house, where the relationship between Hori and Miyamura begins with Hori's discovery of Miyamura's secret.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

[Profile (StarCrew)](https://www.starcrew.co.jp/talent/setoasami/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/SETO_A_OFFICIAL) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/seto_asami) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/seto-asami) | [YouTube](https://youtube.com/@Seto-Asami)

A Japanese voice actress. Her debut role was Yoshino Takatsuki in Hourou Musuko. She likes to draw, and she became addicted to karuta while dubbing Chihayafuru.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chau_kotori)

Graduated from Kyoto Seika University in 2012. Japanese animator, director and storyboard artist. Leader and founder of Studio Colorido's Team Yamahitsuji since fall 2018.

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/). Went through [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/) and [Shin-Ei](https://anilist.co/studio/247/) before going freelance. He is most known for his work on the first season of [One Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/OnePunch-Man/). He is also the original creator of original anime [Sonny Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/132126/Sonny-Boy/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/erkin_kawabata)

Known for his unique episodes on [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/)’s shows, where he was often collaborating with [Shingo Natsume](https://anilist.co/staff/118928/). His storyboards are noted for their natural lighting, preference towards "ugly" and unrefined drawings, occasional use of fisheye perspective, and disturbing subject matter.

Fluent in Russian and has competed in the All-Japan Sambo Championships.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yama_ic)

Yamashita is one of the key figures of the "Web Generation," being among the first to be recruited within the industry not after formal training but after demonstrating his talent by posting animated gifs online.

His first time standing out of the crowd was on [Birdy the Mighty Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/Birdy-the-Mighty-Decode/). His animation favors expression above all else, to the point characters often bend out of shape when exposed to extreme forces and speeds. 

Despite this he still has a keen eye for delicate and realistic character animation, inspired by the likes of [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/Norio-Matsumoto), as demonstrated on both EDs for Birdy the Mighty Decode and [Shinsekai yori](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/From-the-New-World/) where he handled all aspects of the animation production. 

He is also adept in post production work, often handling the photography, coloring and even CG in his own works.
A Japanese anime director, storyboard artist, and animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/75212815)

Fukuda graduated from Chiyoda Gakuen Department of Animation in 1987, after that he started working for Studio Z5, then later on went to work at Studio Gallop, and finally he became a freelance animator. He is however still part of the small studio Asadoya.
